intro: Inversodicraea letestui, commonly known as the Letestu's inversodicraea, is a rare and unique plant species native to the high-altitude regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive floral morphology. The plant typically produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a dense, spherical head, which is a common trait among members of its family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the cool, humid climates of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Inversodicraea letestui is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
